title: Van Morrison - The Best Of Van Morrison and covers @256
description: For an artist that's doggedly album-oriented, plus a songwriter who revels in subtlety, Van Morrison doesn't seem like a logical candidate for a successful greatest-hits compilation. Nevertheless, The Best of Van Morrison is a cracker-jack compilation, tracing Van the Man from his days with Them, through his best-known tunes (&quot;Brown-Eyed Girl,&quot; &quot;Moondance,&quot; &quot;Blue Money,&quot; &quot;Wild Night&quot;), to highlights from the '70s and '80s cult efforts, topped off by &quot;Wonderful Remark,&quot; a song first heard on the King of Comedy soundtrack. This collection makes Morrison's work seem a little more immediate and accessible than it usually is, but that's a blessing, since it provides a great summary of his hits and a nice introduction for the curious. Yes, it could have dug deeper into the catalog, but as a sampler, it can't be faulted.
